message: easy to use, realtime, pretty, public, and archived
this seems like the best Friendfeed replacement candidate so far
most people use twitter for that

I'm not ruling this out, of course.  But while I'm criticizing -- I can't follow people here, it seems I have to connect my twitter or facebook account to have "friends" on convore -- and I don't use twitter or facebook for anything related to what I would want to do here.

I dunno... as per the FF discussion, I worry about a service that doesn't have any obvious income and might feel safer supporting S3.0 than moving here.  (I'm one of those people who pays for email because I don't trust Google.)
their privacy policy mentions possible ads
re income: they did only launch two hours ago

Fastmail.fm -- I have had the account for years, I am used to the interface, it's only $40/year and because I know that they make money directly from the service they provide, I feel more secure than with gmail, which is an add-on to Google's main business.
thats interesting, who do you pay?
I imagine they might also sell extra services of some variety or another
hmm, ok
its about following topics and discussions, not people
Sure, and generally that's better, but I do get a lot of value out of my FF network: I have carefully selected only smart interesting people who contribute mostly signal, little noise!
also Convore has notifications

anyway, surely it's obvious that convore bests FF in many areas: you can have one central place to discuss a given topic, even if its niche, and you don't _have_ to overwhelmed by lots of posts on unrelated topics that happen to be by the same person

Speaking of, there's no way to import feeds here e.g. blogs, saved searches, twitter, etc.  I agree that it's nice to have dedicated space for specific topics, but it's also useful to have a central aggregator to bring together various streams into a place where you can have conversations about particular items from any stream.  It seems to me Convore could do that, too, if they implemented feed import and had a specific group for that view.
hmm
Twitter doesn't work for me at all -- I'm not at my computer 24/7 and miss nearly everything on twitter, in fact I use FF to capture interesting tweets and have real discussion about them.

I guess I am, now that you point it out.  FF has been so exactly what I wanted/needed that I'm really looking for something to replace it more or less exactly, but with security so I don't feel it's going to die like FF probably will.
whereas Friendfeeds are broken
you seem to be very focused on turning Convore into an exact clone of Friendfeed
